snippet: Federal prosecutors in Manhattan face a December deadline to bring additional charges connected to Bernard L. Madoff’s Ponzi scheme. | Standard & Poor’s won more business after relaxing its ratings criteria. | JPMorgan’s chief executive told...
abstract: Federal prosecutors in Manhattan face a December deadline to bring additional charges connected to Bernard L. Madoff’s Ponzi scheme. | Standard & Poor’s won more business after relaxing its ratings criteria. | JPMorgan’s chief executive told employees about the bank’s compliance efforts. | Shareholders of the Dole Food Company are challenging the latest buyout proposal.

headline.main: Associates of Madoff May Face Charges
